content: Seriously @Enbridge: You start w/ @tech_mahindra, not the best choice. Then you want someone w/ 12-20 years of overall experience in critical infrastructure @ $65/hr on #H1B. This screams substandard. Is #Enbridge that desperate for cheap labor? Go for #quality & #competence. https://t.co/D2ZxgakdRj

The use of hard-coded credentials in systems is idiotic at best & criminal at worst. Chirp Systems & their parent company @RealPage obviously didn’t get that memo. Now @CISAgov assigned the flaw a 9.1 #CVSS. HT @briankrebs. https://t.co/R7nCnbcW1y

There is a lots of histrionics about #Iran & #Israel from #CNN, #FoxNews & others. Here are some insights from a friend in Jerusalem that sets the record straight. And it's 100% accurate. @CNN would love things to escalate for better ratings. Sorry CNN. https://t.co/pOrG7gTn05

A #LastPass employee was targeted with #deepfake calls. I’d assume everyone from @Okta, @keepersecurity, @pingidentity to @Microsoft & more are targets in these #phishing attacks.
HT @IonutArghire in @securityweek. https://t.co/IltfBylxmF

Cybersecurity researchers at @sucurisecurity discovered credit card skimmer that's concealed within a fake Meta Pixel tracker script in an attempt to evade detection. #WordPress &  #MageCart are huge targets. Great way to ruin #PCI compliance. HT @jbhall56 https://t.co/UgFnRWwqkL

XZ backdoor could’ve been a huge #infosec disaster, but was narrowly averted. This @xygeni piece details how #XZ backdoor was injected.  Writes how difficult it is to detect intentional backdoors & that backdoors should be considered an internal threat. https://t.co/840WG3SRsr

According to @ISACANews, Continuous Security Validation (CSV) allows an organization to take cyber attackers’ perspective & stress-test its security stance. @PicusSecurity is offering a free course on #CSV fundamentals to help validate & improve #infosec.  https://t.co/9dEuCaOEjD

A #Microsoft researcher found malicious code in #XZUtils. Now #CVE20243094 is 10/10 #CVSS. @Zur_Ulianitzky of @XMCyber_ notes that the vulnerability is only present in pre-release versions, so there is no patch. So revert to previous, unaffected versions. https://t.co/9YYmnmACQW

Many job seekers change their LinkedIn status to #OpenToWork. That won’t get them a job, but opens them up to scammers looking to capitalize on their often desperate hunt for a new job. Scammers use that to trick #LinkedIn members. Don’t be a #scam victim. https://t.co/dg2SbzTR9s

Good overview by @ThomasSegura13 of @GitGuardian of the #xzUtils open-source backdoor that almost compromised #SSH & would have wreaked havoc. It underscores the importance of  open-source software monitoring. Which to date, has been heavily  overlooked. https://t.co/uS9kvz2Rvk

My @RSAConference book of the month review: Confident Cyber Security: The Essential Insights and How to Protect from Threats, by @drjessicabarker, published by @KoganPage. A great introduction to #infosec & a very readable book. https://t.co/tAbW2nOUWq

I shared a story of a @PerceptionPo1nt security researcher about attacks  against @bookingcom. And then discovered an entire industry of  #bookingcom scammers exploiting people needing help. Victims will have  their bank accounts drained afterward. https://t.co/V48N81o3as #scam

A #Microsoft researcher found malicious code in #XZUtils. Now #CVE20243094 is 10/10 #CVSS. @Zur_Ulianitzky of @XMCyber_ notes that the vulnerability is only present in pre-release versions,  so there is no patch. So revert to previous, unaffected versions. https://t.co/9YYmnmACQW

If you store #data in the #EU, the @EU_Commission Cyber Resilience Act (CRA) is a huge regulation you must contend with. Once approved, you have 36 short months to adapt to new requirements. The time to start planning is now. HT Jonatan Bodo of @BugProve. https://t.co/8RLkChcWQc

I shared a story of a @PerceptionPo1nt #infosec researcher on attacks against @bookingcom & then discovered an entire industry of #bookingcom scammers exploiting people needing help. Identity theft #scam has victims' bank accounts drained & zero recourse. https://t.co/V48N81o3as

Email is the backbone of business communications, and yet email is also one of the most common attack vectors for cyber threats. Some good ideas by @RealTonyBradley where he suggests a strategic overhaul of email security postures is needed. https://t.co/GDGMJ6gJDr #infosec

Here’s how conspiracy theories start: What if it was #Microsoft who placed the backdoor in #Debian & #RedHat? @AndresFreundTec of @Microsoft found it & now it makes #OpenSource suspect. Open source is full of rogue actors. But Microsoft is safe & secure. https://t.co/oyspHnofQG

#Deepfake cyberattacks, #phishing & social engineering have all received a turbo boost in recent months due to the proliferation of easily accessed #AI tools. Really good piece by Bojan Simic of @HyprCorp on ways to put kibosh on those #infosec attacks. https://t.co/YC6mOZNsAm

Attackers target hotels & gain https://t.co/7gke6kuT2s credentials. Research by Elad Damari of @PerceptionPo1nt shows how attackers are impersonating @bookingcom & execute malicious payloads. Massive amounts of customer data can be breached. https://t.co/36FDOI8Iq0

FYI @garyleff: Attackers target hotels to gain https://t.co/7gke6kuT2s credentials. Research by Elad Damari @PerceptionPo1nt shows how attackers are impersonating @bookingcom to execute malicious payloads. Massive amounts of customer data can be breached. https://t.co/oqQK4GmDM9

Okta is vulnerable & a prime target. Eli Guy of @XMCyber_ explores tactics employed by red teams to gain entry into a #Okta environment. He shows how attackers use the Okta RBAC module to elevate privileges & move laterally within the @Okta infrastructure. https://t.co/TVHEvjXQB2

When people hear #Nigeria, they think #scam. It's ironic that @PoliceNG @PoliceNG_CRU who have been bribed in the past & let cybercriminals go free, have arrested a pregnant woman for posting a negative tomato puree review. HT @princewill_nimi in @CNN. https://t.co/f3TwEf2YGq

The @NSAGov & @CISAgov released its top 10 cloud security mitigation strategies to make cloud environments more secure. @ShelleyLeveson of @HyprCorp provides highlights of the guidance and what you can do to make your #cloud usage more secure. https://t.co/gFWdQ0rk9c #NSA

You can goodbye to #privacy & honesty on #Glassdoor as they’re adding real names w/o user consent. @Glassdoor prided itself on #anonymity, now it consults public sources to identify users. #Anonymity thing of the past. https://t.co/xqCi276b5Y. HT @ashleynbelanger in @arstechnica.

#PhantomBlu is a sophisticated malware campaign targeting US-based firms. The #malware employs new TTPs & behaviors to evade detection & deploys #NetSupport RAT. It exploits legitimate features of remote admin tools. HT Ariel Davidpur of @PerceptionPo1nt. https://t.co/XcDkBimJcr

Say goodbye to #privacy on #Glassdoor as they’re adding real names w/o user consent. @Glassdoor now consults public sources to identify users. #Anonymity was a major selling point of the site. No more. 
https://t.co/xqCi275Dgq. HT @ashleynbelanger in @arstechnica.

From @KarstenChearis of @xmcyber_: The 3 Big Questions CISOs Ask Themselves. He took the questions from the #CISO & categorized them into three challenges. Important one deals w/   communications w/ board members & executive leadership. https://t.co/YSDn68mpNs #infosec #CSO #CISO

Free breach & attack simulation course from @PicusSecurity.  By the end, understand differences between vulnerability scanning, pen  testing, red teaming & continuous security validation approaches,  and building blocks of breach & attack simulation (BAS). https://t.co/IKpW3ld18l

Informative @gitguardian breach breakdown video detailing nation-state attack on @Microsoft by Russian-backed hacking group #MidnightBlizzard AKA #NOBELIUM between November 2023 & March 2024. If #Microsoft can be breached, so can most firms. https://t.co/ZqZIQRiAID #infosec

In case you missed the obituary, Triple DES died. As @NIST withdrew it 12/31/23. @jbhall56 writes #PCI #DSS implications are significant. It means you need to immediately migrate to #AES as #3DES no longer meets the PCI definition of “strong” cryptography. https://t.co/bfeV507uqj

In 2022 Kaiser Permanente suffered a #PHI data breach. In 2023, they mailed confidential data to wrong addresses. They certainly haven’t learned their lesson as they want a cybersecurity expert w/ many advanced #infosec skills, but @aboutKP only paying a junior consulting rate. https://t.co/p4M4GAGrlE

First, the #conspiracy #theory people were going wild over the Kate Middleton picture. Now a @Boeing whistleblower is found dead due to a self-inflicted gunshot wound. #Boeing certainly wanted him silenced. https://t.co/Begb6jJV0n  HT @Theothebald in @BBC

Got to love the title of this blog post from @AdaptiveShield. #Nobelium #APT29 & #MidnightBlizzard breached #Microsoft corporate email accounts for over a month. It’s not that even Microsoft Isn't perfect, they have never been close to perfect #infosec. https://t.co/5t0zjQznp4

My @RSAConference #infosecbook review: Fighting Phishing: Everything You Can Do to Fight Social Engineering & Phishing, by @rogeragrimesvia @WileyTech. #NorthKorea& #China investing in #phising. Invest in anti-phishing defenses to not be victim. #RSAC https://t.co/JDosKvueWf

#Coper, a descendant of #Exobot malware was distributed as a fake version of @Bancolombia Personas app. With keylogging & interception of push notifications, it’s quite dangerous. And it’s back. Criminal networks focusing on #Mobile #malware. HT @teamcymru https://t.co/yDv1Rap4pU

Very strategic acquisition by @CrowdStrike as they buy Israel based @flow_security for $200M.  This and similar acquisitions will only enhance #CrowdStrike. HT @assafgi in @GlobesEnglish

https://t.co/B1zPYPFi4q

Great @jaysonstreet interview by @McDwayne, where Jayson shares his story. He shares that #hacking is a lot more about using one’s innate curiosity, than just running tools. Lots of life lessons & practical advice for those looking to get into #infosec.  https://t.co/jGogvmeRZa

Really good piece by @lawndoc on @GitGuardian blog on the risks of storing secrets in mobile apps. Shows why client-side secrecy is impossible as #mobile #apps leak secrets. Details best practices for securing mobile app secrets & #infosec data protection. https://t.co/7nHkPoNCnJ

Have an #Amex card? @AmericanExpress was breached & advising customers to review their statements over next 12 to 24 months & report suspicious behavior. For customers, easier to just request new cards. HT @LawrenceAbrams in @bleepincomputer. https://t.co/6Sr9T8lJPg #Databreach

Attack Techniques in Okta Part 1: Deep dive into @Okta key terms.  Technical info by Eli Guy of @XMCyber_. If you use #Okta, important to be aware of the potential attack techniques attackers may try to leverage when targeting users & how to mitigate them. https://t.co/sL9Fopov69

Really good analysis by @igorhsabino of @PhilosProject in @mosaicmag on Brazil's bizarre love of comparing things to the Holocaust. Written in 2021, prescient as to @LulaOficial recent comments comparing #Israel #Gaza war against #Hamas to the #Holocaust https://t.co/LGGWWEYYi0

If you are going to the RSA Conference (AKA the greatest #infosec show on earth) in May, here are some tips I wrote up to maximize your conference experience. @RSAConference #RSAC

https://t.co/IsRhHD6nmS

Research by @proofpoint identified #Microsoft #Azure environment as #phishing targets. @rogeragrimes of @KnowBe4 just wrote a book on the topic & this by @AdaptiveShield  underscores the fact that firms often forget about securing their cloud environments. https://t.co/hcvWnYuoFJ

Hi @AirCanada: Bought 3 tickets. I’m @United Silver Elite. Both United & #AirCanada are @staralliance members. But after spending all that, I can’t believe I still need to pay for seat assignments so we can sit together. Can you waive that as a courtesy given cost of the tickets?

Finally, Signal is rolling out new settings today to let you create a username instead of revealing your phone number to everyone you communicate with. Probably the most requested feature in @signalapp 10-year history. HT @a_greenberg in @wired. https://t.co/HBtkPuS4QG

The healthcare industry has massive amounts of poorly secured #HIPAA #PII. #cybercriminals love #healthcare due to poor #infosec controls & inadequate #cybersecurity staff. And it’s not getting better anytime soon. HT @ThomasSegura13 of @GitGuardian https://t.co/730xR4UvOo

Really good analysis by @ThomasSegura13 & @McDwayne of @GitGuardian on how stolen @Okta authentication tokens led to the @Cloudflare breach. Breach illustrates the threat of secrets sprawl: sensitive data spread across many platforms w/o adequate #infosec. https://t.co/yM0IUvvqca

Really interesting free report by @PicusSecurity on top 10 most prevalent MITRE ATT&CK techniques. They  looked at over 600,000 #malware samples & assessed more than 7M million instances of #MITRE #ATT&CK techniques. #1 is malware tactic #hunter-killer. https://t.co/vX6HiDnn7Q

Security researcher @PsychoMario of @SnykSec found 4 critical container #infosec breakout vulns (#LeakyVessels) impacting core container tech including #Docker, #runc & related cloud infrastructure like #Kubernetes. Remediation needs to be done ASAP. https://t.co/AcDYrqwEfM

This by @XMCyber_ on how cyberinsurance must work better. #cyberinsurance has transformed from nice-to-have to a business essential. But must integrate exposure management into #infosec policies to reduce risk & drive smarter investments in #cybersecurity. https://t.co/Fqk1BV1kZ7

My @RSAConference book of the month review: Israel & the Cyber Threat: How the Startup Nation Became a Global Cyber Power. Details how #Israel became a world cyberpower & how they built up their sophisticated #cybersecurity strategy. Via @oxunipress. https://t.co/27rOS93G7J #RSAC

A security influencer has a program how to get a remote, 6-figure #cybersecurity job in 45 days.  An essential aspect of working in #infosec is critical thinking. One can best show that by not taking a course selling nothing but hope & empty promises. https://t.co/9qKFqjSC8m

While it doesn’t deal with #MeAt21, this piece by @AShiftan of @PrivacyPiiano details the rise in threats to personal data based on research from Dr. Stuart Madnick of @MIT & @Apple. Details escalating threats to #privacy due to cybercriminal activities. https://t.co/kAYWDJb8mX

The #SuperBowl is soon & online sportsbooks have ads everywhere. Think that you  can win back these ‘bonus bets’? Nope: read the terms & conditions. #FanDuel #DraftKings #bet365& #BetMGMare making billions in #gambling profits off these gullible gamblers. https://t.co/MSPPNLL6Sr

#IANAL, but this has no chance of success, as @taylorswift13 using @VenableLLP to stop @Jxck_Sweeney from sharing public data. It might be creepy & border stalking, but no laws prohibit plane tracking activities. HT @justcalmajourno in @Verge https://t.co/VgwUZI4Hug #taylorswift
End of an era as Gil Shwed stepping down from CEO role at @CheckPointSW.  #CheckPoint might be the greatest #infosec firm of all time. https://t.co/bj0Sa4FqbG HT @GlobesEnglish

Really interesting @a_greenberg analysis in @Wired about Appin Technology & how #Appin is using Indian law to get articles critical of their hacker-for-hire business taken down. Read it now as Greenberg expects to receive a takedown demand for the story. https://t.co/8RoGL5CG0o

Top 2024 trend & prediction is navigating #infosec & #compliance. A big area is @SECGov control over #CISO. #SECis increasing scrutiny on C-suite executives. And #CSO could turn into: Chief Scapegoat Officer is #cybersecurity not implemented. HT @Ostendio https://t.co/UWrXr79NZT

Interesting @ronreiter of @sentra_security piece how ChatGPT is a data loss disaster. There’s many #ChatGPT #data #privacy concerns. #infosec tools needed to redact #PII & #PCI data from ChatGPT prompts. If not, will be significant #cybersecurity problems. https://t.co/D9tDkDRDtm
Hi @Change – can you share a few significant real-world events where a Change petition made an actual difference and effected change? #Change.org Change #Changeorg

This looks to be an interesting Feb. 7 webinar w/ Chris Roberts, CISO @boomaero & Tobi Traebing of @XMCyber_ on: Standing Tall: Top Tips for Your Security Posture Program. Tips on how to facilitate the growth executive teams want to see around #infosec. https://t.co/v0KhZsCZhV

Kubernetes service account tokens are exploited in attack chain scenarios. This @GitGuardian piece details how to mitigate the risks & secure #Kubernetes clusters. As #K8 adoption soars, so do #infosec risks & attacks threatening #K8s clusters. https://t.co/eSW7XoFZS2

Hi @Support: I’m trying to assist with a suspended corporate #Twitter account. To appeal that, one has to log into the account. However, due to an acquisition & staff changes, they don’t know the email associated with that Twitter account. So what can be done in this situation?

If you use @Comcast @Xfinity & want to opt out, this article details how. Most #Comcast #Xfinity customers don’t realize default is opt in & they collect data re. political beliefs, race & orientation to serve personalized ads. HT @thiccreese in @wired.
https://t.co/p7D4mElL8j

My book review of ‘Off the Edge: Flat Earthers, Conspiracy Culture, and Why People Will Believe Anything’ by @KellyWeill published by @HachetteUS in @ASIS_Intl @SecMgmtMag. Brilliantly shows how inane & irrational belief in #FlatEarth & @FlatEarthOrg is. https://t.co/Ppvip9f8z3

AI is all the rage & to a degree, full of hype. Developers wanting to use #AI must know how to do that securely in their tooling & processes. This @GitGuardian has 3 tips to do it securely. But it’s important to realize that those 3 are just the beginning. https://t.co/ygQzvYQEg4

Here are 2 information risk concepts many companies get wrong. Includes insights from the very smart Jack Jones of @FAIRInstitute. Many #infosc vendors claim they can help you eliminate #risk. Unless that includes going out of business, they can’t. https://t.co/QQXd1D0Iw2

Fascinating @TheRyanLBaker @CNBC report asks: Are Timeshares Worth It? Answer: Absolutely not! Ignore @HiltonGrandVac @wyndestinations @MarriottVAC @WestgateResorts offers as you can buy used timeshares for $0, as so many people dumping their #timeshare. https://t.co/L8teKTgbRl

The @EU_Commission will soon put the new Cyber Resilience Act in force.  This by @_Reflectiz_  details an overview of the Act & the very deep  & far-reaching implications. It’s a major #infosec undertaking that  firms in the #EU must be prepared for. https://t.co/eFRU7df1of #GDPR

Fascinating @TheRyanLBaker @CNBC report asks: Are Timeshares Worth It? Answer: Absolutely not! Ignore @HiltonGrandVac @MarriottVAC @wyndestinations @WestgateResorts offers as you can buy used timeshares for $0, as so many people dumping their #timeshare. https://t.co/L8teKTgbRl

This looks to be an interesting webinar on Jan. 31 with @aabelak of @sysdig & @hackerxbella of @Forrester on: Navigating Cloud Threats: The Art of Swift Detection and Response. Cloud adoption requires good #cloud #infosec. https://t.co/jIX9z8nojK #Forrester

Contrary to popular belief, not only are there not millions of open information security jobs, there’s limited entry opportunities. Here’s some thoughts how to successfully pursue careers in #infosec& what to do to get there. It’s not a walk in the park. https://t.co/tRpDr1S9Q7

Passwordless authentication is all the rage. In fact, lots of vendors were at #RSAC @RSAConference 2023. Here’s a good #passwordless overview from @HyprCorp. They do note that there are drawbacks. Including costs & dearth of staff with expertise. #infosec https://t.co/RVom2RpRJV

Hi @NRFnews. Really, $3,000 to attend just the #NRF2024 expo? Other conferences like @RSAConfernece and @interop don’t charge for just the expo or charge a nominal fee like $50. #NRF https://t.co/k0z5vAHSvJ

Interesting webinar on ‘Technical vs. Operational: The Future CISO & how you can prepare’ w/ @RealRonSharon & Grant Elliott @Ostendio @Ostendio_CEO. They ask should you be a technical CISO or  operational #CISO? Answer is: best CISOs are in fact both. https://t.co/ON5PQXYiGG

Contrary to popular belief, there’s not millions of open information security jobs. But there are limited opportunities for entry. Here’s some thoughts on how people can successfully pursue a career in #infosec & what they need to get there. It’s not easy.
https://t.co/tRpDr1S9Q7

Hey @SANSInstitute: Can you tell me the connection between you and @SANS_EDU ? Not clear if they are a subsidiary, division of #SANS, or a completely separate entity that just shares the name. #infosec #cybersecurity

Guy Spilberg of @sentra_security says ask this question: Is this asset valuable for the amount of data  it contains or the quality of data it contains?. Focus on quantitative  data’, risk if data is leaked is due to the type of data, yes & amount of data.  https://t.co/Fo0Olye2IG

Quishing is the new phishing. Don’t blindly scan #QR codes. Excellent @PerceptionPo1nt piece investigates the emerging evasion techniques used in #quishing attacks. The evolution of tactics shows needs for security solutions to combat malicious QR codes. https://t.co/xSJDAXSOrT

Too many firms put everything in the cloud thinking cloud service providers will do everything around #infosec & #privacy. Here’s a good piece by @sentra_security that shows aside from physical security, everything on-prem needs to be done in the #cloud. https://t.co/mIEwG6P3zo

My list of the best security books of 2023. Authors are @schneierblog, @stiennon, @theRealSpaf, @josephinecwolff, @spacerog & others. The #infosec book of the year is ‘A Hacker’s Mind’ by Bruce Schneier. @InformIT @wileytech @PearsonNorthAm @mitpress https://t.co/LdAEbdq5RB

Can #AI write secure code? @snyksec notes @elonmusk & @stevewoz have called for 6-month halt on training more powerful #ChatGPT models so focus can shift to developing safety protocols &  regulations. But attackers will use that time to launch exploits. https://t.co/XRP6YsD4fA

Very strategic acquisition by @Okta to acquire @sperasecurity. But it would have been more strategic had #Okta done it before their many #data #breach. And congrats to @ylventures who backed them.  https://t.co/3NMrl2oIXt HT @meirorbach in @Calcalistech. #infosec

It’s time for my list of the best information security books of 2023. Includes titles by @schneierblog, @stiennon, @theRealSpaf, @josephinecwolff, @spacerog. The book of the year is ‘A Hacker’s Mind’ by Brice Schneier. #infosec https://t.co/LdAEbdq5RB

For years @rogeragrimes has been highlighting & wrote a book that multi-factor authentication is not as bullet-proof as it’s often perceived to be. This by Anthony Alves of @BanyanSecurity notes that #MFA implementation can make or break its security.  https://t.co/SWgC5IQvcP

Part 1 from @teamcymru on risk modeling & real-time intelligence. Mature threat intelligence teams can add tangible financial business value & reduce business risk. But the key word is ‘mature’. None of these benefits from the solutions are automatic. https://t.co/dPbEEGWMNj

My book review in @ASIS_Intl @SecMgmtMag of “1% Leadership: Master the Small, Daily Improvements that Set Great Leaders Apart’ by @csoandy from @HachetteUS. Small and pragmatic improvements that can make a good leader great. And a great leader even better. https://t.co/OV5XjDWzDQ

My @RSAConference book of the month review: Practical Data Privacy: Enhancing Privacy and Security in Data, by @kjam via @oreillymedia. If you care about #data #privacy, this is your book. https://t.co/YhTOSWOXP3 #infosec #RSAC

The recent @SumoLogic #breach shows that leaked credentials are still an ongoing persistent threat. Compromised credentials allowed unauthorized #AWS account access. All #SumoLogic customers have to rotate their API access keys immediately. https://t.co/nBaS1bPR6T

I didn’t see this one coming. Major #infosec shakeup at @Microsoft. Perhaps that’s why CSO = Chief Scapegoat Officer. Charlie Bell out, Igor Tsyganskiy in as #CISO. HT @ryanaraine in @securityweek.
https://t.co/iylkXwmDHb  #Microsoft #infosec

Good @teamcymru piece on threat modeling & real-time intelligence. And yes, it’s much more than just MITRE ATT&CK framework. #ATT&CK is static; attackers are dynamic. But any mention of threat modeling w/o referencing work of @adamshostack is incomplete. https://t.co/kaIqNn5LFY

Good piece by Nigel Douglas of @Sysdig & @SANSInstitute. Deep dive into #SCARLETEEL using MITRE ATT&CK. Compromise occurred within #Kubernetes environment. Attackers capitalized on vulns within certain #JupyterLab notebook containers in the #K8 cluster. https://t.co/64pGzez0n9

Hardly a day goes by without an article about ‘millions’ of open information security jobs.  But the notion of millions of #infosec jobs is preposterous. How can you know how many #cybersecurity jobs there are if there’s no real statistical data available?
https://t.co/V6CFJl6ynw

Nothing wrong w/ a free #infosec tool. Cybird is a new security company w/ cloud-based #DNS protection against #scams, #malware& trackers. Free 1-year Family Premium subscription as a beta user. But only until 12/5/23. https://t.co/kC1pExwRXw @cybird_net #cybersecurity#cybird

Aggressive @sysdig 5/5/5 benchmark for cloud detection & response. They say #cloud security programs need new benchmark of 5 seconds to detect, 5 minutes to triage & 5 min. to respond, as malicious actors need <10 minutes on average to execute an attack. https://t.co/9LkSkr7sxw

The @ISC2 2024 Salary Survey lists over 1,500 different certifications. Add one more to that as @xmCyber_ offering a free ‘Exposure Management Certification’ & @credly badge. Great way to master the fundamentals of Exposure Management. https://t.co/apyoLjde9I #ISC2 #infosec

One thing #GDPR emphasizes is “Privacy by Design”. Now, @CISAgov is promoting “Secure by Design”. Promotes earlier adoption of secure #SDLC practices to improve product safety & security from design phase & throughout the life cycle. https://t.co/2AzeBuQ3CS. HT @ThriveDX. #CISA

Not sure I get this @GitGuardian tool. Enter your secret & it searches >20M exposed secrets in public #GitHub repos, #gists, issues & comments. They say it won’t reveal your secrets to anyone, even them. But once you share the secret, it's compromised. https://t.co/sl8MxDAzmO

According to @ISACAnews, @ISC2 & @CybersecuritySF, there's millions of open #infosec positions. @ThriveDX suggests reskilling. It’s a  powerful solution to build strong security teams, close the cyber talent gap & bolster awareness across an organization. https://t.co/JJMUqthquj

Generative #AI is the rage. Developers already incorporate #GenAI into their work. But, GenAI coding assistants should only ever be used in tandem with AI security tools. @snyksec explains why & notes that GenAI code should not be assumed safe. https://t.co/XsQIzdsaOD #ChatGPT

Considering a career in #infosec? Check out ‘Building a Career in Cybersecurity: The Strategy and Skills You Need to Succeed’ by @yuridiogenes via @PearsonNorthAm. It’s my @RSAConference #cybersecurity book of the month selection. https://t.co/wgH82xWZYW

#ServiceNow announced: Misconfigurations within @servicenowplatform could result in “unintended access” to sensitive data. This security exposure is a critical concern that can result in a major data leakage of sensitive #PII & corp data. https://t.co/9J0O7lgrkm @AdaptiveShield

Hey @instagram: Why do you make it so very frustratingly difficult to report #fraud & #scams on your platform? #SandraBullock has 1.8M followers on the platform, but when trying to report someone impersonating her, she doesn’t exist.  #instagram https://t.co/0qiFZnwiwx https://t.co/oN6ElbPGOL
